channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2025071372
item.description:
Report X-2025071372

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-18
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 042/CAR advised trailer 84077 arrived leaking onto the yard (no drains or waterways). ABF advised the freight was double stacked with no blocking or bracing. Cura was called to send out a crew to remediate the spill. Crews donned the appropriate PPE and identified the estimated one half (0.5) gallon release of product to the trailer floor and pavement below. FCE personnel downstacked the pallet and observed one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of Novato Automatic Dish Detergent (UN3266) had a lid that sprang loose due to a load shift. Once the lid was secured, crews tested the pail to see if any further product would release, and the pail was found to be secured. Crews were instructed to remediate the freight for further shipment and processing, so FCE personnel utilized rags and sodium-bicarbonate solution to wipe down the pail then restacked all undamaged freight for further shipment and processing. The impacted trailer floor and pavement were neutralized with sodium bicarbonate, and the neutralized product was collected with hand tools. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the neutralized product and any cleanup debris was generated as waste, labeled as non-hazardous, and staged in the terminal's waste holding room. With approval of the site contact, Kevin Scheidler, crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2025070431
item.description:
Report E-2025070431

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-17
  • City: CARNEGIE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0900 hours on 7-16-2025, the WLE Rook Yard car inspector noticed tank car GATX 204236 leaking down the sides of the tank from the top of the car. He called myself, John Vergis Hazardous Materials Office for the WLE. When I arrived, I checked the manway bolts and found that all of them were less than tool tight with two of the bolts being able to be loosened by hand. I opened the breadbox lid removing seal number 0774725 from the lid. I then opened the Vapor valve to release any potential pressure and then opened the manway lid. I removed old seal 0774724 from the manway lid. The gasket appeared to be in Ok shape but I installed a new gasket anyway. I then closed the manway lid and tightened the lid with the proper torque pattern. I installed new seal number 0000228 on the manway lid and new seal number 0000227 on the breadbox lid. I then had Specialized Professional Services come out of Washington, PA on July 18th to clean the asphalt off the sides and top of the car. I then released the car back into transportation.

item.description:
Report E-2025070417

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-09
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 9, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN1789 was forked and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and sodium bicarbonate to remediate the UN1798-impacted trailer and loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 35-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report X-2025070010

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-25
  • City: LITITZ
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A 6-gallon Pail of UN1824, SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION, 8, PGII was damaged and leaked during transit due to a load shift. LEG personnel noted one (1) damaged 6-gallon pail of UN1824 with approximately six (6) gallons of product released to the trailer floor, concrete, and gravel. Crews deployed a neu tralizing agent to the impacted surfaces until a pH test returned neutral. The damaged 6.25-gallon pail of UN1824 was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes. The undamaged cargo was inspected and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. LEG personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces and worked them in with hand tools. The spent absorbents and all UN1824 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

  • Description: On June 18, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was forked and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum. FCE personnel utilized hand tools to collect all spent absorbents for waste, then used absorbent pads and cleaning agents to wipe down the impacted surfaces of the trailer and any undamaged freight. All spent absorbents and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer floor and the concrete dock and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to a forklift puncturing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Before Clean Harbors personnel arrived, the terminal had put down granular absorbents. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. Two (2) 55-gallon metal drums were used to containerize the spent granular absorbents. ESTES approved of all cleanup and work done. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: At 16:56 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (BCA) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 3 gallons of Industrial Paint Remover & Solvent (hazardous - UN3066) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor near door 262. The terminal has agreed to a contractor for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of UN3066 Industrial Paint Remover & Solvent product released to a 10’ x 15’ area of the concrete dock floor due to improper loading. The contractors cleaned and neutralized the dock floor and restacked the pallet of product. The (2) damaged pails were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums along with impacted absorbents and PPE. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025061338
item.description:
Report X-2025061338

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-02
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Jonathan Santos contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Jonathan stated trailer 571577 was on the string pad in the 042/CAR yard when they noticed that it was leaking. Jonathan stated they attempted to open the door and roughly 6-gallons leaked out of the trailer and on to the yard. Jonathan stated he closed the door to keep the spill from getting worse on the yard. Jonathan stated two PROs were loaded onto trailer 571577, PRO 352225899 and PRO 051871342. PRO 352225899 was (30) 55-gallon drums of UN1866, Resin Solution, Flammable, 3, PG III and PRO 051871342 was (1 0) 1,200-lb Gaylords of flakes NOI, Granules, Lumps, Pellets, powder or Solid Mass, CL 60. It was determined that PRO 352225899 was leaking inside the trailer and onto the trailer floor. Jonathan stated that he was unsure the cause of the spill quantity that spilled. Jonathan stated that the trailer was loaded on 06/1/2025 at 13:24 (EST) at Dock Door 143. Jonathan stated that he did not see any spillage on the yard outside dock door 143 but he did see spillage on the 610 spot were it was staged before it was moved to the string pad. No storm drains or waterways were reported impacted by the re lease. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Reagan Cowdrey for remediation. Safety requested that CURA provide the cause of the spillage and the spilled quantity. *ggattis* The cleanup crew stated the drum was punctured by a forklift while loading.
